messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] History
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s in his autobiography, so I m presuming it was at least true in his mind ... for some old books to use in an altered book project and came across a
messages.messageBody:
On 4/22/06, Ren Allen <starsuncloud@...> wrote:
>
> I told this story at my "Unschooling a Tribe" talk last year!!
> I wasn't sure if it was true, so I prefaced it with "haven't checked
> into the accuracy of this" but as I told it I could see heads nodding
> so several audience members knew it.:)


It's in his autobiography, so I'm presuming it was at least true in his mind
:) I love his autobiography. I found it on happenstance. I was looking
for some old books to use in an altered book project and came across a book
of bio-and autobiographies by Time Books (one of those "looks old and will
look cool on your bookshelf but probaby not something you would actually
read type books). I noticed that one was Ben Franklin and started scanning
it. Ended up reading the whole thing. He lead a very interesting life.





--
Michelle

messages.subject: History
messages.msgSnippet: He was ridiculed once when he was a young boy because he wasted time by floating on his back on a lake.  He was holding onto a kite (Ben and his kites) and
messages.messageBody:
" He was ridiculed once when he was a young boy because
he wasted time by floating on his back on a lake. He was holding onto a
kite (Ben and his kites) and letting the kite pull him around the
lake. His mind was all a whirl on how this was happening and he
enjoyed the feeling of being pulled across the lake by just the wind's
influence on the kite. It's a great story."

I told this story at my "Unschooling a Tribe" talk last year!!
I wasn't sure if it was true, so I prefaced it with "haven't checked
into the accuracy of this" but as I told it I could see heads nodding
so several audience members knew it.:)

Very cool story.
I used it to illustrate how ALL of our children's activities are
important....how we need to trust that they're getting something
important out of even seemingly bizarre activities.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
